reviews.title: I love the phone . im very happy with it
reviews.review_text: great phone. HOWEVER i had to order the phone to be delivered, why twice. because the st croix falls Wisconsin store didnt scan the phone before delivery it. so when i was trying to hook it up with straight talk they said i was never scanded at the store. in other words . it would happen to people that steal the phones . when ordered the 2nd phone i called them and ask for them to make sure the phone gets scanned this time. the response i got from the woman was. oh it was scanned properly we always do. i told her no it wasnt. and then said well please just make sure it is this time. and it wasn't .. im disabled that's why i have stuff delivered. not any more

reviews.title: Very Irritated and unhappy!
reviews.review_text: I bought this phone for my son who is in a halfway house in Mansfield, ohio .It was supposed to be delivered from Walmart. Then I get a message saying it is out of stock and would have to be shipped. Drove an hour and dropped it off to him. He tried to add the minutes I bought but they couldn't activate the phone because no one scanned the phone before they shipped it. Got a run around and theysaid you will hav to take it back to Walmart to return it and get a new one. This is completely unacceptable. I am furious.

reviews.title: SUPPLIER PAY ATTENTION!!! SCAN BEFORE SHIPPING!!!
reviews.review_text: This StraightTalk Phone was a good deal, however, because the supplier who sold me this phone online, didn't remember to scan the cell phone before shipping it so the phone is useless. I had to drive to a Walmart, (I was trying to avoid having to go to a Walmart, hence while I purchased online,) they didn't have the same phone. I had to end up getting a refund instead. It was a waste of my time and now I have to wait several days before my debit card is refunded! Pay attention %26 make sure electronics %26 phones are scanned before shipping! Thanks

reviews.title: ‚ö†Ô∏è WARNING ‚ö†Ô∏è
reviews.review_text: DO NOT BUY ANY PHONE PLANS "before" you purchase the phone (No Refund). DO NOT BUY ONLINE "FOR PHONE ACTIVATION" (If you do; Yes Refund [No Cash] (Gift Card or Debit/Credit). The best way is to activate is to purchase it from the store. If you can't find a $25 phone plan in your store. Don't be fooled to buy what you see there. You will have to purchase it from online or through Straight Talk Customer Service. If you are purchasing this phone for someone else or yourself to do anything else EXCEPT for phone services; YOU ARE GOOD! 5 stars üåü for the Nokia C110 phone, but zero star for online purchase and activation.

reviews.title: Worst pay as you go phone EVER
reviews.review_text: Purchased this phone as a temporary phone for a friend who had lost her phone and just needed something to get her by. Paid for just the least expensive plan which did come with data. However, she had Wi-Fi in her home so she was running off Wi-Fi majority of the time for some reason she could not access social medias at all she could not send or receive pictures at all even with their least expensive plan it should've allowed this I called and double checked with the company they said it should, and for some reason it would not work at all. Their customer service was terrible as with most companies their customer service is based out of another country which is fine however, she couldn't even reach them at all. Every time she tried to call I would have to call from my phone she could not use 611 nor could she call their 800 number I do not recommend straight talk at all nor do I recommend this phone. Worst purchase I've made in a long time save your money it's a waste..

reviews.title: Great phone, Great price.
reviews.review_text: Phone works great. It is basic, but everything works. I am a senior citizen who uses the phone for texting, calling, checking my mail, paying bills. Works well for those things. I don't need and can't afford the newest iPhone or Galaxy. I am very satisfied with the C110.

reviews.title: Not Bad For An Entry Level Phone
reviews.review_text: Overall, it is a decent phone for an entry level budget phone. Some pros and cons about the phone: Pros 1. I like the size and weight of the phone. Yes, it is made of plastic and not feeling premium. But the biggest advantage is that it is light. I don't feel tired of holding the phone for a long period of time. I also like the aspect ratio of the phone. It is not too tall nor wide. Yes it has side screen bezel, but that doesn't bother me too much. I think the size is about right. 2. It's an android without too much add-ons. Pretty close to the original stock android. 3. It has a headphone jack! 4. As long as not running intensive apps, phone temperature is not bad. Cons: 1. It's a budget phone. Can't expect too much performance. Basical tasks such as web browsing, youtubing and messaging via text app will get the jobs done. But any heavy intensive apps will slow down the phone quite a bit and it just lag. 2. The speaker is on the back of the phone and if it is covered up with finger, no sound. So if you lay it down on a flat surface (without a case), you basically can't hear much. With a case, the phone is lifted up a little and the sound is not that bad. 3. Have a review unit and the phone is locked with a specific carrier, can't really test out call quality. During the initial set up. some random apps just keep installing. But after initial setup, no more. So so: 1. The camera is so so. Again, can't expect too much from an entry level phone. It takes pictures, but can't compare the quality to a premium phone. 2. The battery is okay. I think as long as you don't do too much heavy liftings, the battery can last. Standby overnight battery drain is not bad. Things I wish this phone has: 1. In the gesture setting, I wish it has the function to turn on display when the phone is lifted or double tap to awake. Without the function, the only way to wake up the phone is by pressing power button. 2. I wish they change the position of power and volume buttons. Currently, volume buttons are located on the top and power is below it. It takes some time to get used to. Overall, if you are looking for a budget entry level phone. I think it gets job done. Just don't expect too much performance. It is good for basic tasking.

reviews.title: Perfect weight and ease-use combo!
reviews.review_text: The C110 combines the physical features of Samsung Galaxy and Iphones, -square-straight all the way around but on the screen edge. But unlike those two, the C110 is light and slightly slimmer, which makes handle and use easier. The back is uniquely Nokia, -scratch-resistant texture and the good-idea speaker slit on the lower-left corner for better output and reception. It's 9/10 user-friendly, providing logical positioning of the home, back and stop buttons, -much better than the Iphone, Samsung and Google Pixel (my current favorite), Start-up had no issues and copying everything from my current had zero glitches. It has only one camera but pixel at 13megap is more than enough that an average person ever uses but the image, though good, is not impressive. The magnification range adjuster comes up when the image is zoomed, and is a smoother option than the tap-choose option on other phones. Video sound is crisp but faint. Sound recording needs to be improved to allow volume increase after recording. Nevertheless, it has enough user-adjustable features and enough options for quick editing and enhancement, Overall, the C110 is a very good phone to have, but needs a big only-on-Nokia identifiable feature, which I was expecting but did not see or feel.

reviews.title: Decent mid tier phone
reviews.review_text: Got an opportunity to try this phone out and for the asking price its a decent smart phone. It can run multiple apps at the same time but I would still recommend closing background tasks otherwise the vram and processor has issues keeping up. It is only 4G compatible which was also a let down but as long as it still gets support for the operating system its a fair price

reviews.review_text: I had an associate try to make mine work, what she did was scratch off the silver on the time card so I couldn't return it and the phone still didn't work!

reviews.title: Great features, and very user friendly!!
reviews.review_text: The Nokia C100 is very user friendly. This model could easily be my main mobile device with a sim card that adds more space since I understand that it's only 32 gbs. It has similar features of the Nokia 3.4 which made it a snap for me to use.

reviews.title: For the price it's good
reviews.review_text: Got all the updates and the basic functionality . Great for someone on a budget but needs a phone with all the accessories as a high price phone. Still learning how to use it. It is a lower version of the Nokia that I got. I can rock with it üòâüòâüòâ

reviews.title: The person lied to me
reviews.review_text: I asked if I could use the phones on another plan they said yes but when I went to add them they said network locked

reviews.title: Prepaid phone
reviews.review_text: This phone is no good. It has a echo and sometimes when you answer it you can't hear the person on the other end.
ordered online and the phone wasnt scan properlyso i couldnt active it could only use on wifi.. phone is slow

reviews.title: Any Walmart phone
reviews.review_text: Do not order any phone from Walmart!! They send it to you without being scanned %26 then you CANNOT USE IT!!!

reviews.title: Slow
reviews.review_text: Screen size was good was a bit slow and the data didn't work so I had to buy a different phone.
